parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate or party.  The content focuses on child development and social skills, not on any political figure or party involved in the parliamentary elections.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, targeting a broad audience interested in parenting and child development. The message is not directed at specific individuals.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to promote a blog post about helping children develop social skills and build friendships. There is no discernible intention to influence voting patterns in the parliamentary elections.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The content could be considered educational or journalistic in nature, providing advice and information on a relevant topic. It does not advocate for or against any political candidate or party.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post doesn't express personal opinions related to the elections.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>8611361452318900</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, promoting a blog article on child social skills, does not constitute electoral propaganda.  It lacks any reference to parliamentary candidates, parties, or any attempt to influence voting behavior. The content is educational and addresses a general audience, aligning with allowed forms of Facebook advertising. The paid nature of the post does not automatically classify it as electoral propaganda; the content itself must meet the criteria for such classification. In this case, it clearly does not.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Editura Litera</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
